title: Long Troubleshooting and Beginning of the Control Software

content.text_de: Wie sich herausgestellt hat, gab es mit der Ansteuerung, wie sie im letzten Post angesprochen wurde, noch ein gr√∂√üeres Problem. content.text: As it turned out, there was an even bigger problem with the control, as mentioned in the last post. With some movements, the reference point was lost. In other words, the controller no longer knew exactly where the player was. The result was unwanted jumps and missed balls.

content.text_de: Zun√§chst war ich sicher, dass es sich dabei um einen Softwarefehler handelt. content.text: Initially, I was sure that this was a software error. Be it incorrect motor control or a problem with the interrupt that is supposed to interrupt the software as soon as the built-in encoder outputs a pulse. These pulses are (usually) reliably output by the encoder used when the motor moves the player.

content.text_de: Durch viele Tests konnte ich ermitteln, dass es einen Zusammenhang gibt, zwischen den Spr√ºngen, bei denen der Controller die Referenzposition verliert, zu Bewegungen um die eigene Achse, wenn zum Beispiel ein Schuss ausgef√ºhrt werden soll.
content.text: Through many tests, I was able to determine that there is a connection between the jumps in which the controller loses the reference position and movements around its own axis, for example when a shot is to be executed.

I will therefore now replace the power supply with a suitable one. That was also a certain challenge, since the required voltage of 8.4 V is anything but standard...

content.text: The goal is for the system to be able to run at 200Hz on the computer so that the latency is as low as possible. With the first tests, this goal seems realistic. I am very excited about the first complete tests.
